text: about Mar Baselios Institute of Technology and Science
Mar Baselios Institute of Technology and Science overview
what is the vision of MBITS
tell me about Mar Basil Group of Institutions
how good is the faculty at MBITS
is MBITS a good engineering college
responses: Mar Baselios Institute of Technology and Science (MBITS) is a premier engineering college established in 2009, committed to providing quality education in engineering. The college is accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC), reflecting its dedication to academic excellence.

MBITS offers a wide range of undergraduate (B.Tech), postgraduate (M.Tech), and doctoral (Ph.D.) programs in various branches of engineering. The institution aims to nurture students into responsible citizens with a strong sense of social and ethical values.

The college is part of the Mar Basil Group of Institutions, which includes Mar Basil Higher Secondary School, Mar Baselios Medical Mission Hospital, Mar Baselios School of Nursing, St. Mary's High School, Mar Baselios College of Nursing, Mar Baselios Dental College, and MBITS Polytechnic College. This group is owned by the Mar Thoma Cheriapally Kothamangalam and strives to provide quality education and healthcare services grounded in values of excellence, compassion, and social responsibility.
MBITS has been recognized with the New Code of Education Awards 2021 and the Edufuture Excellence National Award 2021 for its commitment to providing exceptional educational opportunities.

The college is an approved center for online examinations since 2012 for various prestigious national-level exams like GATE, CAT, JEE, NEET, JIPMER, AIIMS, RRB, IBPS, SSC, UGC NET, CUET, DRDO, IB, DGCA, NIC, SEBI, UPSC, NTA exams, NBE exams, and many more.
MBITS provides excellent infrastructure, experienced faculty, and well-equipped laboratories to enhance the learning experience for students.
The college is located in Ernakulam, Kerala, providing a serene and conducive environment for education.
Students at MBITS have access to various extracurricular activities and student clubs to enrich their campus life.
MBITS offers placement assistance and training programs to prepare students for their careers.
Admissions at MBITS are based on merit and follow guidelines provided by the respective regulatory authorities.
The college emphasizes research, innovation, and industry collaboration to keep students updated with current technological advancements.

responses: To be eligible for B.Tech at MBITS, students must have passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects, along with one optional subject like Chemistry, Biology, Biotechnology, or Computer Science, with a minimum aggregate score of 50%. Admission requires qualifying the KEAM entrance exam conducted by Kerala‚Äôs Commissioner for Entrance Examinations.

Admission to the B.Tech program at MBITS follows a semester-based examination system and offers lateral entry for diploma holders directly into the 3rd semester. Seat allocation is equally divided with 50% for government quota seats allotted through KEAM rank, and 50% for management quota seats allotted based on KEAM rank and/or qualifying exam marks.

Students without Chemistry but having Physics, Mathematics, and one optional subject from the approved list are eligible. Lateral entry candidates must also meet similar eligibility criteria and seats for lateral entry are divided equally between government and management quotas. A merit scholarship reserves 10% of seats without tuition fees for economically backward, meritorious students under AICTE fee waiver.

For all specializations including Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics & Communication, Computer Science, and Data Science, the eligibility criteria remain the same: pass in 10+2 with Physics and Maths plus one optional subject and qualifying KEAM. Diploma holders can join through lateral entry with half the seats reserved for government quota and half for management quota.

Management quota seats are allocated based on KEAM rank or qualifying examination marks. Additionally, students from minority communities or those scoring above 80% in 12th standard with parental income below ‚Çπ6 lakhs per annum are eligible for scholarships. The entire B.Tech course duration is 4 years, offered full-time and affiliated with Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam.

responses: At MBITS, the formal uniform dress code is followed from Monday to Friday. Students are expected to wear formal clothes during these days. On Wednesdays, students should wear a specific color dress, usually white or light colors, to promote uniformity. Saturdays have a different dress color, such as blue or any other assigned color, making it easy to identify the day. Girls are expected to dress neatly and formally, maintaining a professional and respectful appearance in the campus. Casual clothes are not allowed during academic hours. The dress code helps maintain discipline and professionalism.

text: Is the college union active now?
Tell me if union is alive
Can I join the union now?
responses: The College Union at MBITS is the official student body representing all students. It acts as a link between students and the administration, addressing their concerns. The union organizes many events such as Dance Fest, Arts Fest, Music Club performances, Tech Fest, Talent Hunt, workshops, and seminars. It also engages in social initiatives like community service projects, awareness campaigns, and environmental programs to support society. The union‚Äôs structure includes a President who leads all activities, a Vice President who assists the President, a Secretary who manages records, a Treasurer who handles funds, and Class Representatives for each class. Elections are held annually, allowing students to vote democratically for their leaders. For more information, you can contact via email at info@mbits.ac.in or call +91 9061063801. More details are available on the website: https://mbits.ac.in/about-us/college-union/
